This is CRAP. This is GARBAGE. I'm not putting up with it. Someone should take these guys' money away. In Living Color was great, and I loved Scary Movie I & II. But White Chicks? Now this? They need to get Damon and Jim Carrey back in the fold, quick. It's like the Wayans aren't even trying anymore, just thinking "What garbage can we film and put out for them and still get them to pay to see? HA HA! Got them again!" This film makes "Blankman" look like a movie superhero classic. Any film buff knows what I mean by that. Trash. Let's get this off the #4 spot in the box office earnings, and they'll stop making this bilge. Then maybe we can see them be funny again. Getting kicked in the balls once is funny, and a surprise return at the end might be funny too, but not through the whole movie with fart jokes, etc. Blurgh. Waste your money on something else. I'm just glad it was free for me.

reviews.review_title: Since When Is Rape Supposed To Be Funny...
reviews.content: This is the second time that I'm aware of that the Wayans Brothers designed a rape scene specifically for a laugh...First there was "Scary Movie 2"...The scene with Tori Spelling and a ghost...And now this film...Let me see if I can understand this...Shawn Wayans plays a very naive husband who has sex with his wife...But the wife is overwhelmed with the fact that she thinks that she had sex with her husband twice, which they didn't...Then the covers are pulled back to reveal that Little Man is in the bed...I don't care whether the wife enjoyed herself or not...She was raped because of not realizing that she was having sex with another person...Rape is Rape...And there is nothing funny about it...What makes me really sad is the fact that that particular scene was given away in the Trailer...And the film still made millions of dollars...Like I said before...Rape is rape...And there is nothing funny about it...Perhaps we should take a good long look at ourselves in the mirror and reexamine our morals...Because people who laugh at this sort of thing should have their heads examined...And that's all there is too it...

reviews.review_title: Dude (and little dude)! This is awesome!!!!!
reviews.content: Oh, wow!!!!! How many opportunities do we have in the world of cinema to see such a rare breed of hilarious comedy like this?????"Little Man" is such a hysterical film! Last night (July 14), I was watching "The Late Show with David Letterman" to see "Will It Float?" (I especially liked how that Swedish bed got the nanosecond treatment from Alan Kalter!) when I heard that John Witherspoon (who played Pops) was guesting that night! I've seen the ads and I thought, "Man! This movie's gonna hit rock bottom! But it sure seems funny!" I was right! That scene where the little baby with an adult face was secretly eating Pops' breakfast while reading the paper was second to none! I mean, that is one ugly and one creepy baby! But, oh well. Amazing what one can do with today's technologies, huh?"Little Man" is an excellent film. Go see it. 10/10

It's OCCASIONALY funny , but overall the movie wasn't that good ...
Could have been a lot better BUT it lack of a solid plot. Character's IQ in this movie seems to be down the line . No one is smart enough to be suspicious about what's going on.
The idea of the film was something new but they couldn't make it right with the horrible screenplay

reviews.review_title: If you liked White Chicks you will like this
reviews.content: Some people will say this film is rubbish but that is their opinion.If you liked scary movie and white chicks you will like this film,Just crazy humour and mad happenings.You will like this only if you don't take things too serious when you go watch a movie just switch off your brain and you will enjoy this film for what it is a funny film by those crazy brothers.There are bits where some people will say that is silly,that is stupid but remember people these are just films and this is just a comedy from which the average person should enjoy if they go into the film not thinking this film is going to be great or this film is going to be bad just enjoy sit back and enjoy.

I really can't add any more. This movie is just a disaster from start to finish. The Wayans brothers should be shot for appearing in this appalling piece of trash. One has to wonder why they keep getting work, although if the majority of their future projects are anything like this garbage, then I guess the will be fading into obscurity pretty quickly. Here's hoping anyway! As for the movie itself. It's just plain wrong. There is nothing clever - or at all funny - about seeing Marlon Wayan's face digitally grafter onto a babies body. And as for the 'jokes' - if you find any of it funny then you need to see a doctor. Please do not waste your time or money going to see this.

What's the point of reviewing a movie like this? It's painfully and embarrassingly bad, not even in a way that allows you to make fun of it.Movies like "Little Man" depress me. They represent film at its most disposable. This movie was made for a bunch of 18-24 year old dipsh*t frat boys who the studio was hoping would come out and see it on opening night before word leaked out about how bad it was, so that the film could quickly recoup its investment.A hundred other filmmakers with great ideas probably couldn't get their films made because resources were going toward making this puddle of vomit.Grade: F

Vertically-challenged ex-convict Marlon Wayans disguises himself as an orphaned baby to a yuppie couple (Shawn Wayans and Kerry Washington) so he can reclaim a valuable diamond he placed in a purse while trying to elude the authorities. Also along for the ride is Marlon Wayans' dim-witted accomplice Tracy Morgan and comic book-styled crime boss Chazz Palminteri (no idea what he's doing in this film). Basically a rehash of old Warner Bros. Merrie Melodies cartoon concepts as the novelty wears thin pretty quick. The film starts fairly but the material cannot hold up for a feature-length production like this. The typical insanity and crazed situations would be better suited to a variety show or an animated sitcom. Ho-hum comedic misfire that could only be from the Wayans'. 2 stars out of 5.

reviews.review_title: The word atrocious doesn't do this justice
reviews.content: Where do you start with this? Absolutely horrendous attempt at comedy, it may appeal to those who found Paul Blart, Mall Cop to be worth a good review or anything Eddie Murphy has spewed out in the last 2 decades to be amusing but this is as low as it gets. The original joke just isn't funny, like in so many US comedies, pulling daft faces and wearing geeky clothes will appeal to some but this to put it politely is pure garbage and only one place for it.

reviews.review_title: A serious contender for the worst movie of 2006
reviews.content: Date Movie was awful as well, but it was watchable compared to everything else those talentless hacks Friedberg and Seltzer have churned out. Little Man however is just unwatchable. I don't dislike the Wayans brothers, I did like the first two Scary Movies but this and White Chicks are clear proof they are capable of making trash as well.On every level, Little Man is very poor. The concept was basic to start with, but had the potential to be at least entertaining. Instead it is ruined by some really predictable, rushed and disconnected scenes, and the humour completely fails as well. Why? Because the jokes are unfunny and borderline offensive, and the script is absolutely dreadful having some inane and vomit-inducing dialogue.The production values are in some ways cheap, especially in the rushed editing, and the soundtrack didn't do much at all for me. The direction is smug and ineffectual and the characters are unlikeable and stereotyped. The acting doesn't help to lift, instead every performance because of the dialogue and how the characters are written falls flat.In conclusion, awful film and a contender for the worst of its year. 1/10 Bethany Cox

reviews.review_title: Who gives money for this to be made??
reviews.content: You really have to wonder about Americans. Are they so stupid that this is considered entertainment? Whoever gave money for this to be made should have all their money taken away and be told never to try to do this again.A few glaring errors among the many: No doctor worth his degree would mistake a 40-year-old dwarf for a baby. The head size is all wrong, plus he had all his adult teeth.Pubic hair should have been a strong clue to the other idiots that they weren't looking at a baby. We never see his facial hair grow back or him surreptitiously shaving. That should have been another clue.There is no way he could have driven that car. He wouldn't have reached the pedals.And the idiot husband didn't clue in that his "baby" just had sex with his wife! Even worse, the idiot wife didn't know who she was screwing.I know movies often require suspension of belief, but this is way beyond ridiculous.
I feel as if the acting is corny, and the jokes are really dumb. The plot is unimaginative and needs work.

This movie stunk! Every actor in this movie was annoying, and the humor was tired. Nobody, not one person, noticed that the 'baby' was really a midget? Not even the doctor? There was one part, just one, that made me smile (not laugh, just smile), and it was near the end. It was when Calvin beat up the bad guy whenever the bedroom light went off, then the bad guy said 'Click' to fool Calvin into thinking he turned the light off again. But as somebody else mentioned, that was ripped off from a Bugs Bunny cartoon some 50 years before this movie was made! Still, since it made me smile, I've mercifully given this movie 2 stars instead of one. One funny moment in a movie that is supposed to be a comedy doesn't make it worth watching. Almost anything else is better than this.

reviews.review_title: There's something I need to get off my chest.
reviews.content: So, has it really come to this? Are we, as consenting adults, to blame for the next generation of cinema-goers lack of cinematic understanding and celluloid capability? Concerning the Wayans and Co. latest addition to the moving pictures scenario; Little Man. This United Kingdom P.G. (Parental Guidance), anyone under the age of twelve must be accompanied by a responsible adult, certificated movie, is the epitome of what has now developed into the worse case of dumbing down since cigarettes were "wiped out" from pictures of movie icons of the 1950's.The predominantly under twelve's audience here who, some without grown up supervision too, sat there, obediently, taking it all in, oblivious to their subject and the partly grown up features that Little Man portrays, in part at least too. Movies, in general, can do better than this poor attempt, while this nonsense is getting them in while they are still young and fresh, the biggest fear for the future of Cinema is that a child's ignorance just might carry on through to a grown up bliss. Cinema deserves more than this, and so do its ever growing, and in the literal sense too, audiences, this blatant cash cow feeds on the ever-impressionable minds of the young.There is no Cinema experience here, no open eyed wonder, no awe-inspiring respect to the magic of movies'. There is nothing but bewilderment and contempt, for the lack of substance, originality and its delivery of mind less tedium and parody of everything that is so now ultimately wrong with the Hollywood machine, for the sake of a quick buck, we must endure our future cinema audiences to the likes of this archetypal disaster movie.Will this have the likes of Hitchcock, Fassbinder, Leone, Kubrick and Schaffner reeling in their graves? Money they all liked, no doubt, but talent and exuberance for perfection and quality, and to a vast degree, respect for their profession and audience, they were never short off. We are seeing, once again, with the works of the Wayans clan another cliché of bad taste, while the likes of White Chicks (2004) were in no doubt a stab at the bourgeoisie of American society. The irony here is that the two leading protagonists, played yet again, by the Wayans brothers, are so much undercover, that all recognition is non-existent, this makes for a better movie too, and it is the actor Terry Crews that gives White Chicks its substance and personality, not the Wayans.Yet again, with their pastiche of 1970's Blaxploitation movies, as with the 1988 movie I'm Gonna Git You Sucka, this to can be seen as a comical and amusing movie, with heavy weights as Isaac Hayes, Jim Brown, Bernie Casey and the gorgeous actress Ja'net Du Bois. The point being, that Little Man has absolutely no persona of any kind what so ever, he is shallow and narcissistic, with no appreciation or value toward his followers, he quickly dives in takes your money and before we know it, has hidden himself within the cogs of commercialism. There is no recognisable effort as to where our money has been spent, after Scary Movie (2000), things could only have gone up, but alas they did not, no great pondering of artistic value and no doubt that the instalment from these intrepid movie moguls' next movies shall be straight to video, one can only hope.The Wayans seem to have created a movie genre all by themselves, to a certain extent; they have bludgeoned to death the movie parody, they have watered down each and every avenue and with their inevitable style. They have slowly destroyed the reputation of the last one hundred years that Cinema have given us, may the ghosts of movies past be ever so humble in their judgement, as their growing audiences, so far, seem to be, for when the bubble bursts, may they be as understanding too.

reviews.review_title: I can't believe I was dumb enough to go to this movie
reviews.content: I was very critical of this movie when i saw the previews, just looked like one of the typical fueled-by-enthusiasm movies, but I heard from an internet forum (sigh) a fake review of the movie that lied about plot line and effects, that gave reasons why the movie was rated poorly, blah blah blah. I eventually gave into curiosity and went to see it. About 20 minutes into it I realized that the internet forum was just "trolling" as they call it. The plot had no point, all of the humor required you to have a preexisting liking for the main characters, who I found to all be repulsive. Unless you are the type of person who likes to watch losers run around dating other losers and talking about their uniqueness on MTV, I'd strongly suggest steering clear of this movie.

reviews.review_title: A horrible movie: Life is indeed not fair...
reviews.content: This is indeed "THE" worst movie I have ever seen (And I do average about 150 movies per year). This movie is simply garbage - just garbage nothing more than just garbage.And I submit that anyone who finds this movie not a garbage (let alone being funny) intellectually challenged (regardless of how young the person might be).The story is so idiotic it is beyond expressing. Just to give you a flavor of what this movie is about: It is about a grown up con man who happens to be a migid but pretending to be a little child to be found at the door steps of a couple whom he accidentally hide a large diamond with. The couple apparently are so stupid that they do not realize from the size of this con man's penis (which is supposed to be the high-light comic part of the entire movie) that this is a grown up migid and not a child. Not to mention how these 2 couples don't see that this newly adopted child of theirs is a grown up migid after he sleeps and has sex with the woman (who is now his mother). The story is so sickening and so taboo it is beyond comprehension. To express how I felt after watching this movie (which I never finished watching as I left half way in between), the following can perhaps articulate my feelings:This movie is a proof that life is not fair. There are people dying of starvation in Africa in need of money to survive, and then we have the arrogance and the audacity to spend money on making garbage such as this movie. Just thinking of how many lives would have been saved had the producers of this movie spent the money on saving those lives and instead wasted on a garbage such as this movie, and it makes me want to cry. What is so sad is that the people associated with this movie continue to walk around on this planet and not publicly expressing their shame for being associated with this movie. Yes...life is indeed not only not fair, but in fact cruel.

As posted on www.filmmakerstower.com...My kids (9 and 12 years old) laughed quite loud sometimes. I did chuckle a few times.When you see Marlan Wayans's face on the body of a 4 year old, saying "Mommy!", you cannot help it but laugh. When that little man is stuck in a bag with a dog, it is funny. This story of a little man and his buddy (Shawn Wayans)trying to recuperate a stolen jewel, hidden unknowingly by a young African-American couple, reminds me somewhat of the 1987 Three Men and a Baby. In that story, a baby transforms the lives of 3 consummate bachelors. Unfortunately, the story in Little Man doesn't explore the psychology of parenthood. It explores however the various ways one can be hit in the nuts, it tries to make us laugh with poop, diarrhea, dog urine, things like that.In an unbearable car chase sequence, a woman changes her kids diaper as she chases little man's car. If it had all been a little more realistic, the movie would have worked, in my view. Yes, this is slapstick humor, but it is too exaggerated to be in any way amusing. It's too bad, because the effect of putting Marlan Wayans's head on a different body truly works, and that is no small feat! I found the "making of" section much more interesting than the film itself.After seeing this film, I cannot watch any image and take it as proof of reality. I might see George Bush, on television, but who is to say that the body attached to him is his? Apart from that, the film was not as gratifying for me as it was for my kids. So rent it for your kids, or if you are a special effect fan.

Despite the fact that the message boards for this movie are all negative from people WHO HAVE NOT SEEN THE MOVIE, I have decided that the Wayans' brothers have found a successful formula to make money. I cringed when I saw the trailer for "White Chicks" awhile back, and thought there was no way that thing would make money. I rented "White Chicks" and the movie was funny, as in stupid funny. There are scenes in there that are so outrageous that I had to replay them because they were funny in the aforementioned "stupid funny" way."Little Man" follows the same formula. After spoofing "hood" movies years ago, these guys take a silly premise, and surround their cartoon world with non-expensive white actors with talent, plenty of potty humor and attractive women to keep the interest of the 18-24 year-old males who enjoy this stuff.The graphics are not great. Transposing Marlon's head onto a little person is not seamless, but fifteen minutes into the story, you accept how it looks. Their homage to "Baby Buggy Bunny" is pretty much scene by scene, but they always add a little sentimental note by having the titular bad guy (Marlon, aka Little Man)) go through a true character arc. He is a little one note with his exaggerated facial expressions, but this is a Bugs bunny world.There are surprise cameos by well known comedic actors who also do these types of movie, but don't receive the same harsh criticisms the Wayan's get. One never hears of non-white people bagging on Adam Sandler et al, because they don't like the plot of a film, but nearly all films made by black actors are techno-lynched without being viewed. And the votes are skewered beyond belief. But I digress."Little Man" is a movie you see for the same reason one goes to see silly comedies. Cheap laughs, silly sight gags, and free air conditioning. I give it a 7-10 because I know it will get slammed on here, but the fact is, they will make a lot of money off the DVD. "White Chicks" made ahem....$117 million. Prepare to see more from the Wayans with that kinda dough rolling in.

reviews.review_title: Really badly misjudged and delivered throughout, I've seen funnier hate crimes
reviews.content: When career criminal and "little person" Calvin gets released from prison he wastes no time in robbing a jewellery store of a priceless and famous diamond. Pursed by the police he hides the diamond in the handbag of a passing couple and makes his getaway. He needs to retrieve the diamond in a way that doesn't attract attention  so force is out. Luckily he overhears Darryl and Vanessa discussing having a baby together and spots his way in. Disguising himself as a baby, Calvin abandons himself on their doorstep and is taken into their house. The perfect cover and total access, what could possibly happen other than the conclusion of a perfect crime and, of course, hilarity?There's no point getting upset about it, the Wayans brothers have not only made films but will continue to get money to make more. It doesn't seem to matter how good or bad these films are, they will still get more money. I never bothered to see White Chicks but I didn't think they could have a worse idea  until that is, I saw the detail of this film. The plot is nonsense but that goes without saying. A bad story from the Wayans family is something I have come to expect but I did not expect just how tasteless so much of the content would be. This is a film that not only delivers the expected bodily function and physical pratfalls but also has time for rape and sexual harassment as subjects for the audience to supposedly be rolling with laughter about. To be honest though, if I had been laughing at these things then I would not be phrasing it like that, but the problem was that I laughed literally twice in the entire film. Both of these laughs were when one character repeatedly gets hit in the crotch and they were more of pleasure of even having a small moment of humour rather than the gag being good.The dearth of laughs mean that the plot is exposed all the more for the hideous creation it is. I was shocked to see the writers trying to produce an emotional core or theme to the proceedings  an attempt that fails badly. Not only did the material make me a little queasy but the poor effects did as well. Marlon Wayans constantly looks really badly superimposed and animated and the motions of body/head made me a little seasick. His performance is not much better but to be honest how can one judge the performance of actors in this film? It is easier just to make sure they are reminded that they did it as often as possible. Washington is better than this, much better. Shawn Wayans deserves it and Witherspoon at least has made a career out of this sort of performance and just ticks the boxes off. Palminteri must have needed a new car urgently, otherwise I have no idea what else would have made him take this work.Little Man is bad across the board and I can genuinely find nothing to recommend it for. I watched Norbit a few days ago and at least I had the make-up to praise, but with Little Man it is literally a creative, comedic and narrative void. I hope everyone involved can look past the money they made (and believe it or not, it did make money) and consider the implications of what they have done.

When watching little man , you'll spend its running time trying to figure out its many plot holes . And thats not a good sign because this film is supposed to be a comedy ! Your supposed to be laughing at it !! But will you ? Probably not. The main problem with little man is its concept- its far too ridiculous to accept (even as a cartoonish comedy ), so when the loud , laboured and over the top jokes kick in , they make the whole thing seem ten times stupider than it already is."But its a comedy " some of you might be screaming. Thats true but thats no excuse for such a dumb plot.I mean come on , think about it if you saw a baby with A GROWN MANS FACE , wouldn't you be the least bit suspicious? And if calvin wanted to hide the diamond so badly, why didn't he put it in a nearby shelf instead of a random womans hand bag? And how can a qualified doctor NOT recognise that calvin is a grown man ? i mean seriously...what ? "Its not about the plot , its about the laughs" you might be screaming . Well heres the thing see, there are hardly any laughs in little man and that just make the dumb ass plot stand out all the more. If you really want to watch a wayans brothers comedy with a belief suspending plot, stick to white chicks because at least that had a few decent laughs.What ever you do steer clear of little man.

This is exactly the reason why many people remain homeless . . . because stupid producers pay their money to make awful films like this instead of donating if they can bother!This film is even worse than white chicks! Little Man has a lame excuse for posing a character midget as a baby. Story is awful considering it was written by six people. The idea still wouldn't be too bad though, if it was original and not a rip-off of a cartoon episode. it has funny moments but some of them are way over-done and some are just stupid. The acting was very, very bad. So was the directing. Anyone involved in this film should be ashamed of themselves. it is racist and very offensive to midgets. I mean, instead of showing sympathy to them, the film-makers make fun of them! It really disgusts me how they do it. They see midgets being just like babies. Don't watch this film. It is a huge waste of time and money.

reviews.review_title: A movie that transcends all comedy levels
reviews.content: Little Man Review Little Man consists of some notable actors who have starred in such widely acclaimed shows as Sonic Impact and Baby Ruth and the Candy Bar.The premise of the movie is about a wannabe dad (Shawn Wayans) who mistakes a vertically challenged criminal on the lam (Marlon Wayans) as his newly adopted son.He's so desperate for a son of his own, that he and his wife (Kerry Washington) decide to shower all their love and affection on the lovable little impostor.The beginning of the movie starts out strong much like the movie "The Thin Man". In fact if I didn't know better I would think that the producer borrowed every bit of the Thin Man character development to give depth and meaning to the protagonist who would have otherwise never have garnished an emotional attachment from the audience.The affectation the protagonist garners on his would be adopted son is one of the most profound, touching moments in cinematic history. The see-saw of emotions continues when the criminal's partner arrives on the scene quite unexpectedly.Throughout the movie one gets a sense that the antagonist is speaking directly to us. In fact is this appeal that brings a richly deserved praise to the otherwise empty plot.Of course all love is lost on the antagonist when the two felons rob a jewelry store together and then proceed to take advantage of the sweet parents.The humor weaves its way in and out like so many gadflies on a pile of dung. It is this humor that allows the audience to identify more with the vertically challenged negro than the supposed good guy (Shawn Wayans) who gives a surprising rendition of a concerned Dad; the likes of which have not been seen since Ward Cleaver's in depth discussion of puberty to his sons.The movie capaciously deserves 10 stars but in retrospect the Fictional Reviewer gives it 3 stars for the unnecessary adulation of vertically challenged black people.

reviews.review_title: incredibly dumb humor, but you'll find a laugh or two
reviews.content: Catching this on Starz on Demand, I wasn't really as judgmental of the movie as I would have been if I watched it in the theaters or even if i rented it. If I were to do either, I'd certainly mourn my wasted money and been way more harse on the final product as it's not worth paying to see. I was also surprised that I laughed a few times (no not during the endlessly abundant fart jokes nor the many MANY 'hit in balls' gags). This tale about a midget who masquerades as a baby to get back the loot he stole is extremely derivative of an older BETTER Bugs Bunny cartoon, however if you have nothing better to do one night and you're REALLY bored and this is on TV, you could do worse. Everyone who says this is the worst comedy in recent memory just haven't watched the travesties that were Little Nicky, Clifford, Eight Crazy Nights, or the Benchwarmers to name a few. As far as Wayans brothers films go I'd put it above White Chicks and Scary Movie 2, but below pretty much anything else they've done. Keep an eye out for the hockey fight scene as it's probably the highlight of the film.My Grade: C-

When I first saw the trailers for this film, I didn't think much of it. I've just got back from the cinema, where I saw the film, and I've got to admit it was an enjoyable film.I don't know why, though. Most of the humour in this film revolves around slapstick violence, which is in itself mainly based around the fact that one of the instigators of the violence is tiny. This sounds horrible, I know it does, but it is actually not that bad (barring a few parts).This film does, for example, have the only *good* "repeatedly being hit in the balls" gag I've seen. Ever. Lots of movies try it, but this one does it well, even though it's fairly obvious what's going to happen.This film also has some of the most annoying performances I've seen. Ever. I have no idea what John Witherspoon was on during the filming of this, but I have the feeling it'd put half of Holland to sleep. I realise the character he's playing is supposed to be a bit crazy, but I quite honestly felt like throwing my shoe through the screen whenever he was on it. Kerry Washington also annoyed me at some points, but that was mostly due to her character's lines rather than how she delivered them.Shawn Wayans puts on a surprisingly (for me, at least) good performance. He's believable, you like him, and he plays the whole thing very well (whereas I've already mentioned that some of the actors seem to think they're rehearsing a wedding or something, rather than making a movie).The actual plot (a stolen diamond) is pretty much forgotten throughout most of the film. Once Marlon pretends to be the baby, until the very end of the movie, the diamond is pretty much a useless part of the plot (other than it's involved in a very annoying fart / crap joke, as well as a fairly amusing scene in which a group of mothers beat up a guy). But with this kind of comedy, you know you're not going to get much of a plot-heavy movie anyway, and that should be taken into consideration.All in all, this is a decent film. It's not perfect, but I honestly have no idea why it's in the bottom 100. It's honestly not that bad. But if you don't like slapstick involving midgets, this film really isn't for you.

reviews.review_title: Number Seven On The Bottom 100 List?
reviews.content: This movie received 10 stars from me for two reasons. #1 Any movie with fly Kerry Washington deserves 10 stars. #2 It takes a whole lot of creativity to make a movie this stupid! Also the scene when Kerry was about to cry when John Witherspoon was taken to a mental institution There are some unanswered questions in this movie. How did Shawn Wayans' wife react when she found out that Marlon would stay with them at the end of the movie. How come no one else but John Witherspoon could tell that Marlon was not really a baby.

And I'm sure this is where they got the idea, but will not admit it. By the way - speaking of previews, this is why I knew "White Chicks" would be bad, and didn't bother seeing it. Following on from the critically panned White Chicks, which I admit I did find relatively funny in parts, this was the next supposedly terrible film from the Wayans brothers, from Razzie nominated director Keenan Ivory Wayans (Scary Movie). Basically dwarf criminal Calvin (Razzie winning Marlon Wayans) has been released from prison, but with the help of his idiotic brother Percy (30 Rock's Tracy Morgan) they plan their next robbery very quickly. With his height being the advantage, the short crook manages to sneak under a diamond case in a jewellery store and cut out the priceless gem, and the plan is to hand it over to mobster Walken (Analyze This's Chazz Palminteri). But when the robbery has its little snag, Calvin hides the diamond in the purse of passer-by Vanessa Edwards (Kerry Washington) who with her husband Darryl (Razzie winning Shawn Wayans) are discussing the wish to have children. So Percy convinces his brother to shave his beard off and cress like a baby to pose as an abandoned child left on the doorstep and get into the house and retrieve the diamond. Obviously this is not easy as Calvin cannot seem to get a free moment to get it back and escape, with the "parents" being so connected to their new arrival. Darryl and Kerry notice small oddities with their "baby", such as tattoos and a smoker's health problems, pointed out by the doctor, but they cannot get child/social services involved for a couple of days, so they keep him in the meantime. As Calvin tries to convince them he is a genuine baby, and obviously steal the diamond and get out of the situation, the couple think of adopting him, the old man Pops (John Witherspoon) is overly suspicious he is not a real baby, and Walken is getting impatient with Percy. After numerous mishaps, gross moments and subtle disasters, Darryl does eventually realise that he and Vanessa have indeed been fooled by Calvin into thinking he is a baby, and they obviously find the diamond. In the end, after all the confessions have been brought to the surface, and Walken ends up being arrested, Calvin seems to have nowhere to go, and with no family of his own he is obviously sad to be leaving, but Darryl forgives him and they become friends, and the parents have their own real child. Also starring Scary Movie's Lochlyn Munro as Greg, Molly Shannon as Soccer Mom, Brittany Daniel as Brittany, Family Guy's Alex Borstein as Janet, Anastacia and twice Razzie nominated Rob Schneider as Dinosaur Rex. After watching it, I can see how this film was in a way inspired by the Bugs Bunny cartoon "Baby Buggy Bunny", but anyway, the Wayans brothers together are terrible on screen here, the story has too many obvious attempts at awful humour, and no okay special effects can save it, I might have murmured a laugh, but it is an atrocious comedy. It won the Razzie for Worst Remake or Rip-Off and Worst Screen Couple for Shawn Wayans and either Kerry Washington or Marlon Wayans, and it was nominated for Worst Picture and Worst Screenplay. Poor!
Very funny and very unique I loved it every second of it, it was so funny And I was crying at the same time

As a viewer, suspension of disbelief is critical in the success of any cinematic experience - this movie fails in that regard. No suspension, no disbelief: just awful, unbelievable crap that fails not only as a comedy but also as any form of escapism. If you wish to escape from life for a couple of hours, watching this movie will not get you there.The visual effects of transposing the adult actor into the form of the 'baby' is poor. Believing that the foster parents accept the 'baby' as a baby is beyond belief... As other have commented, the crotch related 'humour' is tiresome and infantile. It was not funny or humorous: it was simply poorly scripted and shallow. You will not see any awards or nominations for this movie, plot, actors or otherwise. It is immediately forgettable (except it is so bad) and that is the way it should remain.Somehow this movie made it on to Saturday night prime-time TV where I live: a sad indictment indeed of Peth, Western Australia's free-to-air TV programming efforts. Yes, 7 Mate, you wasted an opportunity to increase viewer numbers for your advertisers.
I forgot how funny this movie is. I laughed like I did when I first watched it. Definitely a classic!

Stars: Marlon Wayans, Shawn Wayans, Kerry Washington, Tracey Morgan, John Witherspoon, Lochlyn Munroe, Chazz Palmenteri, Brittany Daniel, Alex Borestein. With appearances by: David Allen Grier, Molly Shannon and Rob Schnieder.This was horrible. Everything about it was bad. It deals with Calvin (Marlon), a midget thief being released from prison only to steal a diamond. By accident, he lands it in the hands of goodhearted people wanting a child, Darryl (Shawn) and Vanessa (Kerry Washington). To fool them into taking him in, his friend (played horribly by Tracey Morgan) dresses him up like a baby. The acting in this is pathetic, especially by Shawn Wayans, who gave one of the worst performances I've ever experienced. The only actual actor in this was Chazz Palmenteri, who played a very unbelievable gangster, due to horrid writing. I chuckled a few times during the film, but it was mostly because of how bad the acting and writing was. Several people show up in cameos, including Rob Schnieder. He recently said he'd never work with Mel Gibson, yet he'd work in this in a dinosaur suit? Whatever. I hated this movie and so will you.My rating: 1/2 out of ****. PG-13 for sexual content and language. 88 mins.

reviews.review_title: At least SOMEBODY's going to be happy!
reviews.content: The producers of "The Blues Brothers II" movie and "Kicking and Screaming" (among others) will be ecstatic about this monstrosity as they will no longer be competing against each other for the title "Worst Movie Ever Made". "Little Man" is easily the most offensively bad film in creation. In the worst excesses of Hollywood, there has never been a more abysmal effort. It is quite frankly an insult to the intelligence of any sentient human. I feel violated having paid out good money to the movie theatre to sit in the audience and have it thrust on me. The only reason I didn't leave and demand my money back is that I was so shocked at how bad it was, I couldn't believe it. It was like a car crash: absolutely horrific to look at but compelling because of its awfulness. A new champion is born.

I can't believe how a so funny movie can get a so low rating. If you decide to go and watch this movie after watching its trailers for sure you will not be deluded. The general idea is very original and the special visual effect is perfect. A lot of funny situations make you L.O.L. Wayans brothers are really very good comedians and the director is very good. I loved this movie as I loved "Bad Santa". People in the movie theater seemed enjoy very much and they applauded at the end. Keenen Ivory Wayans directed "Scary movie" and "White cheeks" too, so you already know what you are going for. Some nice cameos by famous actors give an extra-touch to this movie. I'm a white man but I have often noticed that when a movie has a black director and a black cast a lot of people give low rate just for that. We have to accept that a lot of good black movie creators (Spike Lee, Antoine Fuqua, John Singleton, and others)are ready to make good or funny movies and they are very welcome

reviews.review_title: A Criminal Midget passing himself off as a baby to get his ill-gotten gains back
reviews.content: I was not impressed about this film especially for the fact that I went to the cinema with my family in good faith to see a film which was certificate rated 12A here in the UK. To my dismay, this film was full of embarrassing sexual jokes. (Which is not a problem to me as an adult, but not good for watching with children). This film at times was very crude at times with fart jokes, getting hit in the groin etc... and for the most part of the film not very funny.The premise of the film is that Calvin Sims who is a 2inch midget, gets out of jail and steals a giant sized diamond but is then forced to put it in a womens handbag. So the rest of the movie sees him passing himself off as an abandoned baby, getting into this womens house so he can get this diamond back.Up until now, I have enjoyed most of the output from the Wayans Brothers - but this film is certainly taking the biscuit.A Bit of good advice - wait till it comes on TV or Cable

The story line was brilliant, and something different. I think they should make a little man 2. reviews.review_title: Since When Is "Rape" Supposed To Be Funny..??
reviews.content: I think I've had just about enough of The Wayans Family. I really don't understand how this particular acting family keeps making money at the box-office. It just doesn't make any sense.The only reason I gave this movie a shot is because of the fact that Brittany Daniel was in it. In fact, she is why I was even able to finish watching the film.The scene that upset me enough to write this review had to do with the title character crawling into bed with the wife of Darryl played by Shawn Wayans.The wife is looking overwhelmingly satisfied in the morning which confuses Darryl because she is convinced that they had sex more then once, which they didn't.Oh hey, the little man is in the bed, which means what? That the wife had been raped and didn't realize it? Why is that supposed to be funny? I have never felt so sick to the stomach in my life...And to make matters worse...This very scene was used in the movie trailer and the film still made money at the box office...What's wrong with this picture..??It doesn't matter if she enjoyed herself or not, rape is rape, and there's nothing funny about it. This movie made me sick, and that's all there is too it.... ....

The scene that upset me enough to write this review had to do with Marlon (little man)Wayans crawling into bed with the wife of Darryl (Shawn W.) The wife is looking very happy in the morning which confuses Darryl because she is convinced that sex had occurred between them more then once, which wasn't the case.The little man is in the bed, which means the wife had been raped and didn't realize it because she thought she was having fun. Why is that supposed to be funny? It doesn't matter if she enjoyed herself or not, rape is rape, and there's nothing funny about it. Unbelievable, a film that created a rape scene designed specifically for laughs. This movie made me sick.

I saw this movie because it was 98' outside and there was a laugh or two in the coming attractions. It is, despite the slings and arrows of most on this board, the funniest comedy since 'Team America.' Or maybe 'The Devil's Rejects.' Which are named as examples to separate the wheat from the chaff in terms of the quixotic sense called a sense of humor. And, although I could not convince those who have seen the movie that what they saw was a nine not a one and was milk snortingly funny, I submit this contrarian view in hopes that it will encourage others to give it a try. Silly, yes silly, politically incorrect...of course. Sexual innuendo/scatological/infantile (if you like puns in reviews)/racially insensitive/racially challenging/dumb? Well, yes, and most importantly in a comedy...funny.Very funny. You will laugh until you hurl.

reviews.review_title: I'll never miss a Wayans Bros. film
reviews.content: What I do not think that a lot of people are understanding is that it's not a real boy actor with real good makeup on. It's a Wayans brother and trick photography they use to make him look little.I didn't get that at first so I was sorta creeped out, because I had a cousin who had a baby and the baby had an old man face and even when the baby grew up it still looked like one of them old-fashioned men you see sometimes in photos from the Civil War.I have a cousin name a Rimmy Jo Buckles and she lives in Fayetteville and one time she was watching a Wayans Bros. movie and she said she laughed so hard that Diet Mountain dew came out her nose. What was funny is that she was drinking a lemon lime powerade at the time and while the colors are similar I can assure you the taste is not.Anyway, you should see this film if you like funny stories and then you'll have something to compare and contrast against this.

I took my daughter and niece to see Little Man, against my better judgment. I was totally dissatisfied the language content and sexual overtones. The think what bothers me the most, is when African Americans in the movie industry, become more interested in the almighty dollar as opposed to the images or messages that are being sent to African American youth. I really wish that I could write to personal letter to every African American producer, director,or actor to challenge our people to be more sensitive to the needs and concerns of the parents in our communities who are really working very hard to maintain the innocence and decency of the minds our youth. We are trying to support our African American brothers and sisters, but I feel like many of them have written us a "bad check".

This film is good with plenty of laughs, it is a want to watch not for the kids though. I think the Wayan's brothers are the best comedians out there, i cant wait for them to make another movie. I mean there is 3 of them and their father also does some directing too. The first half of this movie is not excellent it does drag on a bit but later on in the movie it tweaks up a lot!!! The story line could do with a bit of adjusting it is a bit cheesy but the basic plot is good you will understand what i am saying when you watch the movie. so to sum it all up a watch this movie if to be honest don't bother going to the cinemas because you might not like the movie, but you may as well rent it out if you feel like a laugh.

1712/5000
Little Man is a 2006 American comedy film produced and directed by Keenen Ivory Wayans and starring Marlon Wayans, Shawn Wayans, Kerry Washington and Tracy Morgan. Little Man had his script written by director Keenen himself and his brothers Marlon and Shawn Wayans, who starred in the film.Calvin Sims is a dangerous jewel thief who is not even a meter tall. Fresh out of prison, he decides to carry out one last major robbery before retiring. The chosen target is the famous Queen diamond, for which Calvin and his partner Percy will receive $ 100,000. The assault goes awry and Calvin hides the diamond in Vanessa Edwards' purse, which takes him home without noticing the extra baggage. Calvin and Percy follow her and witness an argument that Vanessa has with her husband Darryl. He wants to be a father as soon as possible, but Vanessa thinks having a child can hinder his career as vice president of an advertising agency. Taking advantage of the cue, Calvin and Percy devise a plan: posing as a baby, Calvin would be left at the door of the Edwards' house. They, enchanted, would take him inside the house, where the thief could steal the diamond. The plan works, but Calvin didn't expect his baby life to be much more complicated than he imagined.I have already reviewed this film several times and saw it again because today I wanted to see it! Very cool, elaborate film, no matter for the Wayans family, critic sites always criticizing their films negatively do not care for them! In the Afternoon Session on Rede Globo.

Little Man is one of the most beautifully acted films that I have seen in recent years. The Performances by Marlon Wayans and Shawn Wayans are spectacular. While Kerry Washington plays the stand out role of a mother/wife, who has slowly and methodically grown distant and quite mad over the years of their marriage, I believe that Shawn's performance is just as impressive and equally mad. In dealing with a wife who is as immature as his own children, Shawn is reduced to dealing with her in extreme and embarrassing ways.The tension begins when Darryl, played by Shawn Wayans brings his co-workers back to his house in the morning after a long night shift, which probably was not the smartest idea because he had broken a long standing date with his wife the previous night. I suppose he brought them back for his own protection, thinking that maybe the presence of other might help to suppress an incident with his wife. Her bazaar awkward interactions build until Darryl has to yell at Vanessa (Washington). From there it only gets worse. Vanessa's fickle and fragile mental state makes for a strange situation for her children. After practically kicking them out of the house in the morning, a few minutes later, she is begging for their presence once again. She waits in frantic anticipation for the bus to arrive and collects her children at the foot of the bus like a mother has not seen her kids for years. The way in which she acts towards the father of her children's play date is that of a twelve year old. The father does not seem comfortable at with leaving his children with a woman who he thought to be drunk, but later finds out just to be mad. After he tells her so, her demeanor immediately changes once again and she has a look of shame, like a child who has just been scorned by a disappointed parent. Darryl arrives in a fit of rage that seems a bit over the top. He strikes her and it is in this scene that one realizes the exhausting effects that his wife's strange behavior has on him. It drives him to lash out and act in equally irrational ways. His patience is constantly being tested.This is a common theme throughout the movie. It seems that every family member seems to have the right idea of how to fix this family and is not afraid to voice their opinion. Darryl's mother is one such character. One of the final scenes is when the family is gathered around the dinner table after Vanessa's return from the hospital. Darryl's mother and other family members refuse to accept Vanessa's request to be alone with her immediate family thinking that the best thing for her is to have people around. This ends badly and Vanessa is almost forced into a type of relapse. Darryl is constantly trying to keep a dictatorial control over his family no matter what the cost - understandably so, as he has been pushed to this point psychologically and physically as he strikes Vanessa into sanity once again.The movie is a strange demonstration of family life. I think it's extremes are meant to display that all families have their problems and deal with them under their own circumstances. Is it right for others to intervene? Who makes that decision? The voyeuristic quality in which the film was shot also incites a feeling of guilt in the audience for witnessing such atrocities and also instills a feeling that they are a present member of the family and a first hand witness to the troubles that they are experiencing. The movie was enrapturing from beginning to end.

reviews.review_title: Getting blood drawn is infinitely more fun than this movie
reviews.content: Why isn't there an option of 0 out of 10? This movie makes all the other 1/10 movies look bad.I went to this movie not of my own free will, but because my group wanted to see it. I thought it looked horrible from the commercials, and I protested violently about seeing it.... but alas, the herd mentality won out.Thank goodness I didn't pay the $8.25 for seeing this film, because it was a complete waste of my time and their money. I gave a half-hearted chuckle twice during the entire film. Anybody who knows me will tell you that I laugh at EVERYTHING.A guy being hit in the balls is only funny for so long. Spoiler Alert!!! This movie was all about how many blows to the crotch it could land. There's so many let's see first he hits Daryl in the crotch with many toys. It's not funny the first time! Then he punches John Witherspoon there, because hey as a little guy he couldn't take him down any other way. Then after climbing inside Rob's suit Calvin bites Rob Schneider presumably in the crotch. And at the end he hits all three of the criminals in the crotch at least once. I mean it gets old and just isn't funny at all. This film's script really isn't all that good either I mean seriously Calvin is a bad guy that deserved to get sent back to jail. Why would it end the way it did? reviews.review_title: Offensive trash which doesn't offer any laughs what so ever
reviews.content: (Plot) a bumbling fool (Shawn Wayans) winds up taking care of a midget (Marlon Wayans) who just happens to be a notorious criminal. It's as ludicrous as it sounds What is with comedies these days? Is it me? Am I too picky? I really don't think I am I'm a guy who enjoyed Disaster Movie, and that's high up in IMDb's bottom 100 list, so it really can't be me. I'm just so tired of abhorrently lazy stuff like this. This movie is filled with unfunny stereotyping, White people acting like they are black and many other unfunny gags. You're telling me that having Marlon Wayans portray a midget brings in almost 60 million at the box office?! It's insulting to one's intelligence and makes me weep for the future. I also don't normally find The Wayans funny in anything. They were good in the first Scary movie, but that's it. I don't remember a whole lot about this movie, and there is probably a reason for that. Final Thoughts: Life is too short to give your hard earned money to these cretins. Say no to the Wayans family!2/10

This has an overused plot device but I can't say it doesn't work. Although this movie is funny as hell, there lacks common sense. No matter how you put it this story isn't believable, which makes it hard to watch at points for me. There are some parts that are a bit much and annoying. Scary movie was unrealistic but it was supposed to be because the plot was just making fun of other films. They try to do this here by pushing the story to its limits but since it's a real life story it doesn't work as well. I'd say it's worth watching while drunk.

reviews.review_title: I didn't know Satan made movies
reviews.content: Satan has to have been involved in this movie because it would take an expert on all that is painful, traumatizing, and just plain wrong to churn out such an unappealing "film" like this. Maybe Old Scratch asked to be billed as Alan Smithee because even he was ashamed of the end product. OK...where to begin? Well, for starters no one in this movie seems to have any basic intelligence. Even the doctor that the incredibly stupid baby loving couple takes the thieving midget Calvin to must have gotten his degree from some four week online course. If what you're looking at has the face, bone structure, dental formation, and every other characteristic of a 40-year-old man...THEN IT'S A 40-YEAR-OLD MAN. I'm sorry, I want to go on but this movie makes me so angry I fear if I keep typing I'll end up crushing my keyboard in a fit of rage, so I'm stopping this review short.

One of the Wayans brothers best. Went in not expecting much, I was laughing so hard at one point it hurt. Tracey Morgan does great and ChazPalminteri is a great bad guy...again.They do place some race cards and stereo types, but more making fun of them than playing them up. Funny movie no matter what your color or ethnic background!

I think its pretty safe to say that this is the worst film ever made, When I saw the trailer on TV i knew right from second 1 that this would be a piece of **** and it would be best to avoid it, but I somehow got dragged into seeing this by some friends, I walked into the cinema with low expectations but i was hoping there would be a couple of cheap laughs to keep me awake during this film. The so-called "jokes" in this film bring a cringe to the face, they are mostly comprised of people taking hits to the face and balls, the baby looking weird and acting like a horny gangsta and the typical race jokes we see so often in todays garbage comedies. The film is obvious and the story is not only impossible to believe but also predictable and dull. The characters are extremely annoying and heavily stereotyped. I never want to have to see this **** film again, I'd rather take a bullet to the foot than be exposed to this piece of fuckwood ever again. If anyone I see says they liked it i will physically punch them in the face

reviews.review_title: What's idiot, annoying, and smelly ? A Wayans Movie !
reviews.content: It has nice idea and bold visual adventure, with mostly an annoying outcome. So let's review why that happened.Filth, filth, and filth. I don't know what's remotely funny about tasting a dog's urine, or rubbing a cookie up a butt then eating it. The thing is the Wayans brothers love such a sense of humor. And I became sure that they know nothing about making comedy but it. Look at the movie; it's all about the butt, the penis, the nuts. How many time the nuts of someone got hit in here? No. The real question is: Didn't they get board with repeating it?! I was sick not due to seeing many jokes of that sort only, but to not seeing anything else them too!Then, the incredibly ugly performance of (Shawn Wayans). Please, quit acting pal. It's for your sake and ours. Since you have no charisma, ability of acting, or an atom of comedy. OH MY GOD, this guy is A-one failure who doesn't change. He has the perfect specifics for a Razzie, rather the ones the Razzie was modeled for! (He worthily won it for that year). The second worst actor goes to (David Alan Grier) as the singer. That was designed to be bad in a funny way; however it ended up as bad and unfunny in no way!Then, the script. For most of the time, it goes nowhere. Scene like the one in the stadium seems written after the movie was over. And if I talked about the mistakes, then I would write a book. Just remember: The little man talks to the kids, trying to sell them naked photos, or hits the actor in the dinosaur costumes, etc. And nobody ever tells the parents about it?! The diamond is bigger than the little man's mouth though he swallows it?! The police come to the house to see the so-called baby holding a gun, threatening the bad guys AND DON'T SUSPECT A THING?!! The husband demands from the little man, at the last minute, to lower his voice while talking about strippers so his wife doesn't hear; the so wide-awake writers, directors, and actors of the movie forgot totally that the wife wasn't even there, since she ran after her father short time earlier. That, as a whole, whether shows the movie-makers as stupid, or their assumption of us as stupid!Yet, on a deeper level, the naivety is maybe more powerful. I mean that grandpa waited so long to tell the police about that fugitive that they have at home. Instead, he bought a secret camera? (a new definition of FORCED!). The wife couldn't tell who slept with her?, especially when it's a midget!!, too much of course. And when they left a room for that criminal at last, I felt something wrong; the guy slept with the lead's wife you sane people!Faraway from that: Being based on a cartoon movie, Baby Buggy Bunny (1954), is a big challenge to undertake in the first place, I loved it apart. The visual effects were good, but not that good, because some shots looked so fake with lighting over (Marlon Wayans)'s face that obviously differs from the total lighting of any scene he's in. (Tracy Morgan) did a very good job despite the shortness of his role. (Kerry Washington) made the things believable and balanced with her rational performance. (Alex Borstein) was adorable too. The serious parts (the monologues that express the importance of being a parent, the devotion for it, or the feelings of the criminal towards the family that he accidentally wins) are somehow well-made, however delivered badly from (Shawn Wayans)' side. I liked the way how the boss thinks that the husband is involved in the crime which paves the way for final encounter between the leads and the gang, Ahhh.. lastly an evidence of intelligence!The scene of (Morgan) going to the boss (Chazz Palminteri) with a bag full of kid's stuff as the one with the diamond is the only wonderful comic moment here. And, surprisingly, it has nothing to do with filth. So, it is rare. Just why this movie wasn't made with many "rare" moments like this? At least it would have been not rude, and fit to be watched for more than once too.(Little Man) is like its little man; a funny criminal who goes into our houses with a lot of noise and a few laughs. So, eventually, it annoys more than gives a joy. In fact, the Wayans brothers make you thank God that movies aren't made with smell!

"Little Man" is your typical Wayans comedy. The type of humor is no different than their previous movies (White Chicks, Scary Movie, Scary Movie 2, etc). This movie isn't suppose to be taken seriously (*cough cough* IMDb users *cough cough*), but it was a great comedy popcorn flick to kick back, relax and sit through on a Saturday night. The special effects were decent. After 5 minutes into the movie, I was already use to seeing Marlon's head stuck on a midget's body. No biggie.I thought the movie was funny. Plain and simple. Sure, there are some cheap laughs here and there, but there are also scenes that made me laugh my ass off along with the crowd. "Little Man" had the crowd laughing from beginning to end. Don't get me wrong though, this movie isn't 100% comedy. There is some heart in this movie as well, along with some drama. Overrall though, its just a fun movie.If you've enjoyed the Wayans previous projects, then be sure to check out "Little Man" at a theatre near you.

This is a very good movie, I can't understand why people have given this movie such bad rating's, I have watched this movie 2 times and I laughed nonstop all the way through, its very funny, and very a+++, and possibly one of the best Wayans comedy's since scary movie.The writing was good, the movie was very good, the acting was good,the whole movie is good, I love it, this is what comedy is supposed to be.I suggest if you like true comedy you should go out and buy this today, because this movie is much better than scary movie 3,4,and if you like scary movie 1,2 you will love this.white chicks was good but this is much better. a+++ all the way through.

Little Man Starring the Wayans Bros (Malron & Shawn Wayans) Directed By Keenan Ivory Wayans, and Written By all Three.Here's a Brief Plot Summary:A wannabe dad (Shawn Wayans) mistakes a vertically challenged criminal on the lawn (Marlon Wayans) as his newly adopted son. This Film is brilliant, funny and Excellent at the same time from start to finish.With one liner's every Minute or so including one of my favourites"That's no baby ,that's a porno Star" a funny one liner By John Witherspoon (See also Wayans Bros (Show)- He is absolute funny in this movie).if you liked In living Color(Colour),the Wayans Bros.(show), Scary Movie & Scary Movie 2 and White Chicks trust me u will love this movie.My rating for the movie 10/10

reviews.review_title: You will actually become dumber watching this movie.
reviews.content: This has got to be the worst movie I ever suffered through, it was on one of the HBO channels and was half watching it while cooking. I watched it expecting to see a train wreck, and it was even worse than I could have imagined. I imagine the Wayans brothers will go down in history along with the makers of such films as Soul Plane as people that completely destroyed any upward movement by African-Americans as a group. What I don't understand is why they do it and why these films are distributed. I realize that for every 1 decent Hollywood film there are 100 bad ones that suck and lose money, but it seems that with black films they will just release whatever garbage is produced to fill that market. Is this really the type of thing that black people enjoy? That's what these films tell the world.

Little Man really is something off a last resort, I hate that I'm slagging off this film because I really am a fan off the Wayans brothers & co. (Shawn & Marlon Wayans act & Keenen Ivory Wayans directs) however this really is not one of there finest pieces at all! The film is boring in many scenes and just isn't funny and is very unbelievable I mean the doctor doesn't even notice this is a 40 year old man pretending to be a child off less then 2 years I mean the 'kid' has a full set off teeth, a tattoo & a stab scar! Apart from the fact it's so unbelievable it's laughable the film is almost disturbing I mean the 'kid' Calvin is practically morally wrong and almost a pervert I must have laughed about twice but most of the sex jokes really were vulgar and unnecessary. The whole film is just weird that Calvin thought it was OK to actually pretend to be someone's child. Mostly I didn't like this film apart from the occasional laugh. Really is a last resort to watch.

Best movie I've seen in a month and I've seen some shitty movies! I read a pageful of flacking reviews for this saying the good ole "this is the worst movie I've seen". Oh, please. Once you get over the fact that Marlon Wayans is playing a cgi-faced baby you'd realize this is actually a not so bad comedy. In fact, it's very entertaining. And it actually has some heart, which is always a huge plus. Every actor does their job without a gripe. The only off-putting thing is when the "baby" goes off-character and becomes the thug he is, but that's part of the whole plot, so... In the end, comedy is always an acquired taste. Give this a shot if you like the Wayans Bros and mindless family fun!

reviews.review_title: A great original idea, but unrealistic as a Disney movie.
reviews.content: I rented this with my girlfriend and we sat down to watch this the other night. i gotta say i was laughing my head off, and it did have a good moral in the end, but there was only one problem...it was unrealistic.OK, So to tell the story, it's based on a vertically challenged man working with his "OG loc" (AKA, Wannabe Gangsta) in order to steal a valuable diamond to bring to their mob boss. however, the diamond ends up in a woman's handbag, and in order to get it back, the dwarf has to pretend to be a baby, and get the diamond and escape. Meanwhile, the woman's husband has been desperate to try to have a son, and when the little man posing as a baby arrives at his doorstep, he's more than happy to take a chance to prove to his wife that he can be a good father.This movie was certainly cleaner and more family friendly than White chicks, which was a masterpiece by the Wayan brothers, and it played the perfect moral that needs to be overdone...how to be a good father. it also wasn't Sex-saturated which was really nice. it had a fair amount of violence which was OK. However, it was unrealistic.For one, A Fiberglass Hockey stick won't break 1-inch thick plexiglass, and a plastic bat won't make a 7 foot tall guy bruise.But the bottom line is, this movie's worth a rental, or a buy. it's funny and it has some morals. it's tuned towards the teenage audience but kids will enjoy it too, as long as you explain some parts to them.7/10

reviews.review_title: How many crotch jokes can you put in a movie?
reviews.content: I actually lost count while trying to monitor this thing. If there was ever a movie that should inspire new writers out there, this has got to be it.If this is what sells to today's public, everyone I have ever met should be signing up for writing courses. Because if you have ever sent an email... if you have ever written a thank you note... if you have ever just signed your name... you could do better than this.I thought with success came responsibility. I thought with success came a commitment to continuously try to better yourself with each project. The Wayans seem hell-bent on leaving a legacy of the worst kind of mimicry and banality.

Yes it is a silly farce so can't be taking all that seriously...But it does have some slapstick funny moments like the Hockey scene, the birthday party with the Father/Son game and the robbers getting took down...If you catch it on TV or cable, it is worth it!!!!

reviews.review_title: It's 2006, and there are still directors this retarded

reviews.review_title: Think Bugs Bunny 2006. Amusing and Daffy and yes, Stupid
reviews.content: The movie was supposed to be stupid just like the 1940's Bugs Bunny cartoon that it was based on. If you've never seen a 1940's Bugs Bunny cartoon, you got to see one. Then you'll be able to appreciate the comedy style.It's supposed to be over the top. It's supposed to be looney. It's supposed to be daffy. It's supposed to be moronic, sophomoric, and crude. Think Foghorn Leghorn. Think Daffy Duck. Think Elmer Fudd. Think Tweety Bird. I'm surprised an Acme anvil didn't fall out the air.I don't particularly care for the Wayans humor but the trailer showed that the movie was going to be stupid, but fun and amusing. Anyone who thought it was going to be anything else was fooling themselves and cold stone trippin'. Marlon is no Denzel. Shawn is no Jamie Foxx. And they weren't suppose to be. And no one would dare compare Kerry Washington's role in this movie to the role she played in "Ray." If you have a good sense of humor, just relax, let your heart be light, don't be so pessimistic,and you, too, will find this movie amusing. It's not terrible, F, and it's not great, A. It's just an average movie, B.The visuals with Marlon as the baby were a SCREAM. Yeah, sometimes you could tell it was phony but again, relax, let your heart be light, go with it. You make the visual correction yourself so you can stay with the story. This effect is what makes the movie good to see in a theater so you can get the full appreciation of the scale. If your summer plans are to have fun, go see this movie. It's fun.

Since this picture is classified a "pure entertainment" work and since there are already many comments on it, I'd like hereby to address something relevant to the abuse of humour. We can see that Marlon Wayans is playing the joker role in this film. Certainly as long as he has been involved in the casting job, he has always been acting as a little man-an actor can change his customary dress but can hardly change his physical appearance-and the latter one can be an advantage when necessary. However far away from what I expected, I saw an image very disguising, pretending to expose different aspects of the baby life by mistake of a forty-year- old criminal. And with a ridiculous happy ending. So what is the point? Many elements are mixed up, some principal ones are violence, sex and criminal activities, amongst which the story is badly composed and to some extent, lack common sense: where is Vanessa when the peace of her house is violated and her husband's life being pursued? In addition the diamond is even bigger than the world's No.1 Cullinan! But the most sickening facet is the continuous attempt to make up the little man as a superman by showing his physical weak points. And they call it humour. A diamond is precious, hard and fragile; it cannot be cut by any other material but only be conquered by the hot blood of a male goat. Hence it's no more a diamond but pieces of debris.

Little Man is a light-hearted, slapstick, comedy brand new from the Wayans Brothers (Scary Movie, White Chicks). Imagine an adult orientated Home-Alone-Type comedy and you're somewhere near what this movie is offering.It features a midget (think mini-me) as a master jewel thief on his newest venture, complete with a ditsy accomplice and a tamer-than-your-average bad guy. With that in mind, it's easy to understand why this movie may seem as an offering for the kids, but it's absolutely not.The movie is packed with sex references, some strong. So who is this movie targeted at? I don't know, and I don't think the makers know either.The humour is slapstick (frying pans, blows to the privates) with, in most cases, a real lack of depth. On top of this, the more intelligent of movie goers will easily find themselves predicting what's about to happen next, with an alarming rate of accuracy.Next we move on to the plot. It's unrealistic and extremely far fetched  yet that alone could have easily been passable. Combined with the facts above, though, and it adds to the lack of thought and originality that is this movie. With a 60 million dollar production cost, it makes you wonder just where all that money actually went.Despite all the above, there are one or two (literally) brief moments where the movie is genuinely funny. Yet, by the end, the jokes have become repetitive and worn. You may well find yourself thankful that the movie didn't have a longer runtime.If slapstick comedy is your thing and a poor, predictable, plot is passable: This movie may well be for you. For everyone else, I'd advise this one to stay as a last-resort at your local rental store.-James Capu

reviews.review_title: I doubt these things come as much of a surprise...
reviews.content: "Little Man" is a film about a...vertically challenged (is that correct?) man who is released from prison, and immediately partakes in a jewel heist with his idiotic partner. While hiding from the police, the "little man" places the stolen diamond in the purse of a random woman shopping with her husband, who just happens to really want a child. The chase ensues. Now, looking past the fact that...uh, little people (?) do NOT look like babies, and that most adults are NOT stupid enough to think that a baby would have tattoos, gold fillings, and knife-fight scars (which I know are meant to be jokes, but they are also NOT funny), this movie was still horrible. I am sick of seeing movies where a small person who, simply because they are an adult, have the strength of an adult regardless of their actual size. These are the type of films that make (I don't mean this as racist) black movies do so badly. The Wayans Brothers have done good films in the past, but this is NOT one of them. Avoid this movie at all costs, unless you like bad directing, acting, editing, and jokes.

They're both working for Chazz Palminteri who comes off as a real stiff here.When the diamond gets into the possession of our young couple, Wayans makes believe he has been abandoned at their door. Wayans acts as a baby and we're subjected to foolish situations such as the use of a rectal thermometer, touch football and of course the mob going after everyone for that precious diamond.The diamond might be precious but the movie is far from that. Written by Keenen Ivory, Shawn and Marlon Wayans, I expected their new release Little Man to be full of laughs like their other films. Surprisingly this one falls flat, but quick laughs get them past. A midget ex-convict (Marlon) is fleeing from the police after stealing a diamond and while in a store he places the diamond in a bag carried by a man and wife (Kerry Washington and Shawn Wayans). To get the diamond back, both the midget and his partner (Tracy Morgan) devise a plan that has him posing as a child and getting access into the family's home. After seeing films like Scary Movie and White Chicks, you kinda figure out the Wayans humor and go in expecting them to follow up. But instead the film is too tame and dull and is revived by quick scenes that get you to laugh. I was really disappointed with John Witherspoon's character because he didn't do the signature improvisational routines that he does in other movies. It just wasn't what I expected but I can't say that it wasn't worthwhile seeing the film, maybe I had too high of expectations but it wasn't really my cup of tea. I can watch it on TV but I'll skip buying the DVD.Little Man - ** out of ****

reviews.review_title: A believable idea, but something went wrong with the application.
reviews.content: It's possible and believable had they made "Little Man" 5--maybe 6--and white. Look at the head and facial features of some white adults and then kids. If you watch the movie "Orphan" look at the head sizes and facial features on those kids and look at the adults in the same movie. Also, there is a condition where people are really short, but have normal adult faces when they mature. A white person with such a condition might pull it off, because their faces allow it. Many white kids have adult heads and adult facial features, so their features almost cross over. The only thing would be that whoever you got would be an acting novice. Black adult faces have features that no black kid would have, so how could you trick someone into thinking that an adult was a child when that outcome of having everything line up as it does naturally in many whites would be like someone winning the lottery of world?! That's what made it all wrong! The problem was not really with the idea, but the applicative vision. It seems like to me that once the idea had been put out there, KIWayans should have been asking himself what scenarios allow this to be believable. If he did his homework, then those are 2 of the scenarios listed above.

One day, Darryl opens the door finding a baby on his doorstep. I guess Darryl was extremely blind because he couldn't tell that this "baby" was really Calvin played by Marlon Wayans. The only resemblance Calvin had as a baby was he was small. Yet an adult face on a baby didn't seem odd for Darryl! Calvin was a jewel thief running away from the cops. After stealing a diamond from a jewelry store, he was cornered by the police. He quickly slipped the jewel into a random purse, which happened to be Darryl's wife. Calvin had to follow them home, dress up as a baby to go under cover and get the diamond.This "comedy" was hardly funny. Too many parts were boring, and if not boring then stupid.I will give this movie a 2/10. Don't see the movie.

reviews.review_title: There are far more eye rolling scenes than worthwhile moments
reviews.content:
Little Man (2006) is a movie I watched for the first time in a long time on HBOMAX. The storyline follows a little person who is planning a robbery with his friends. Things go wrong during the escape causing him to lose some stolen diamonds in another family's bag. The family is desperate to have children so the little person finds this as the perfect opportunity to pretend to be a baby and leaves himself on the family's doorstep. As soon as they find the little person the hijinks begin.This movie is directed by Keenen Ivory Wayans (A Low Down Dirty Shame) and stars Shawn Wayans (White Chicks), Marlon Wayans (Requiem for a Dream), Kerry Washington (Scandal), John Witherspoon (Friday), Tracy Morgan (Copout), Dave Sheridan (Scary Movie),
David Alan Grier (Boomerang) and Molly Shannon (Superstar).This movie has an absolutely all star cast and should have been so much better based on what they had to work with...but the concept was so bad and executed even worse. The CGI Marlon Wayne and the circumstances they put him in were painful. There are some good one-liners and zings and Wayans vs Witherspoon kept the movie moving. There were some sequences and lines that make you laugh but there are far more eye rolling scenes than worthwhile moments. Overall I would score this a 4/10 but still recommend seeing it once.
