reviews.review_title: This film is a wretched assault upon the soul of mankind. It attempts, and fails, to find humour in rape, scatology, sexual assault, and paedophilia.
reviews.content: America. A land of freedom, of hope and of dreams. This is the nation that, since its independence, has striven to bring democracy, prosperity, and peace to the entire world, for the good of all mankind. There are times, however, when one cannot help but wish that the American's would just stay on their side of the Atlantic. This 'movie' (and I use that word with some reservations) evokes these feelings with an intense purity. This vision of hell follows the adventures of Calvin, a freakish jewel thief who was created by attaching the severed head of Marlon Wayan onto the body of a two foot-high dwarf. After inadvertently dropping a large diamond into the handbag of Vanessa, a career-woman who is reluctant to have children, Calvin realises that in order to recover the diamond he must ingratiate himself with her. So, as any normal man would, Calvin dresses himself up as a 2 year-old and parks himself upon the poor woman's doorstep, where he is discovered by Darryl, the broody husband of Vanessa. Darryl incongruously falls for Calvin's disguise despite the fact that the 'baby' has a full set of teeth, stubble, a tattoo, a knife-scar, and the sex-drive of a 16-year-old. Even more absurdly, Vanessa doesn't see past Calvin's baby-wear either and actually attempts to breastfeed the diminutive pervert. This wretched assault upon the soul of mankind attempts, and fails, to find humour in rape, scatology, sexual assault, and paedophilia, however, in a dishonest attempt to transform itself into a piece of 'family-entertainment' the Wayan brothers stir in a sickening amount of sentiment and flawed morality. The brothers dim attempt a Freudian rehabilitation of their thieving rapist by revealing that he "had a bad father". Repeatedly hitting Darryl in the crotch enables Calvin to develop the loving father-son relationship that both he and Darryl have always wished for. As if this wasn't ridiculous enough, Calvin's attempts to sexually assault Vanessa somehow convince her that it is selfish for a woman to indulge herself with a successful career, and that instead she should spend her life playing the role of the housebound little-woman, who spends her time alternatively squeezing out babies and cooking for her husband. In this movie the Wayan brothers have mixed their crass and twisted form of humour together with the clichéd sentimentality that has infected much of Hollywood's recent body of work. Additionally, they are endemic of the current generation of black comedians who are responsible for transforming African-American humour into a poor and wretched shadow of itself that over-indulges in fart-jokes and crude sexual gags. By rights these two should be legally barred from picking up anything even remotely resembling a camera ever again. Unfortunately the current artistic and moral bankruptcy of American cinema means that by this time next month they will undoubtedly have filmed two sequels and be making millions of dollars from tacky merchandising deals.

reviews.review_title: Bad News: Not as good as "Scary Movie" Good News: Hell of a lot better than "white chicks"
reviews.content: Little Man Review- 7 Stars Out Of 10 Okay, allow me to begin this review by stating I am not a fan of the movie White Chicks at all. The reason for me stating this is because it seems as though many people have been comparing the two films...but the difference is that Little Man actually has jokes that work without being forced. It seems as though I could laugh at a joke in this movie and then move on to the next scene satisfied with the last. In my opinion, White Chicks did not allow me to do this...and instead it tried to make me keep laughing at the same thing for a couple of minutes...and that did not work. The Wayans Brothers definitely are not back to their 'Scary Movie' form...but Little Man definitely showed signs of improvement. I think any fan of a silly, fun comedy would enjoy this film, and although it definitely is not this year's summer blockbuster, comedy-lovers will leave the theater satisfied.

reviews.review_title: A daily comment from Midget Emma: Little Man (2006)
reviews.content: I bought this with some birthday money. I do regret it. But i am always happy to have an extra DVD on my shelf. Little Man had some funny scenes.The way they put Marlon Wayans head on to little Linden Porco's body was OK. Sometimes it is hardly noticeable but the other times it looks like Marlon Wayans head is just floating there.I basically laughed only twice. The only reason this gets 3/10 is because i found that the idea of a short person with a full grown celebrity where his head should be was creative and i laughed a few times.The acting was exactly what i expected. Just plain acting with no special performances at all.I am very interested to see what the Wayans are going to come up with next.Even though i said it was creative doesn't make this a good movie. I don't recommend it but see it if White Chicks is one of your favorites. It wasn't as funny as White Chicks but it dished out a couple of laughs but nothing else.3/10

reviews.review_title: Ha ha ha that movie was hilarious
reviews.content: Okay so basically you can expect the movie to be a total piece of crap, not even a funny piece of crap. From the Wayans brothers previous movies, White Chicks, don't be a menace to south central, and blank man, the scary movies, and even the lady-killers, you can guess are all going to be low rated, and disliked, but you can also expect them to be hilarious. Even though the total plot and just general plot of it sucked, it was hilarious. They meant the "little man" hilarious. IT was a funny movie it was like white chicks, Don't be a menace, and the spoofing of the scary movies. All in all it is one of the funniest movies i have seen in years!

You have to realize how much work went into this movie before you judge it. The Wayans brothers probably put forward their best work into making this film. Every single movement of the little boy had to be edited in perfectly. This in itself earns the movie some respect.The storyline is different and unique. It's not a typical movie that has been done hundreds of times. This movie is the only movie I've seen that has a storyline like Little Man.The comedy leaves some room for improvement. For the most part, immature jokes are spread through the movie, with some rather funny parts in the middle. I laughed quite a few times, while being overloaded with bad jokes at other times. But judging by the main stars, you'd expect that. A few immature jokes don't hurt anyone.Overall, I think this movie is definitely misjudged. It's not the best movie ever made, but I have seen much worse with higher ratings. I would recommend this movie.» Garrett Dareson

The Wayans Brothers are modern day Marxists! I refer, or course to the brilliant Marx brothers-off-beat, funny, and sometimes misunderstood. Their body of work will be judged like a pot of homemade spaghetti sauce that gets better the longer it cooks. In this outing, the boys have Damen cast as a midget felon who poses as a baby to recover lost loot. Brother Shawn is cast as a young, yuppie married man. Shawn and his wife happily take in the "baby" and the "baby" takes them in for the duration of the movie. The combo of the little body with the big, twisted brain, sets up dozens of great laughs. The movie does have a very serious message-laughter is good for you.

This movie is a good time! It's certainly not Shakespeare but it gives you a chance to get away and have a great laugh! A Good cast with the Wayans providing some fine tuned comedy and supporting with John Witherspoon as the Father to the newly parented couple. A Cameo appearance with "The Guy in the Dragon Suit" and a good job from Former MadTV's Alex Borstein. The Effects will give you a chuckle as will the cartoon slapstick style and timing.Don't let the Borish critics dissuade you from having a silly laugh from some well laid out comedy.Andy

reviews.review_title: HILARIOUS! One of the best comedies ever created!
reviews.content: This movie is funny. You won't be giggling, no- you'll be rolling in the seats laughing! What a great movie-going experience! Better than "Pirates!" The Wayans crew do it again! If there is one movie to see this year, this is it. With sophisticated humor blended nicely with slapstick and memorable jokes, this is a near perfect example of what cinema should be- thought-provoking and a good time.A cult-classic for all ages, this film has a grand plot. A midget has to pose as a baby! Hilarity ensues. I will certainly buy the DVD- and another for my nephew! So go ahead, head down to your local theater, get the biggest popcorn they offer, and just have a blast with Little Man!

reviews.review_title: Anyone who doesn't enjoy this movie must be from the "dark side".
reviews.content: Little Man was so funny. Definitely the funniest, movie of the year! A must see for people who love comedy.I've read negative comments about this movie and having SEEN IT with my six year old daughter, I'm surprised to hear comments that would discredit this movie. My daughter and I laughed from the beginning to the end. She got all the jokes and quotes them continuously at home.Good old fashion fun humor and a great movie for the whole family to enjoy. I'm so glad that the Wayans brothers made a PG-13 movie so that children can enjoy comedy in a real movie and not just only in cartoons. I will see it again! I heard they are coming out with a cartoon movie on Nickelodeon.If you're offended by comedy you should go see suspense and leave the commenting to people with a sense of humor. Anyone who does not enjoy this movie is probably from the "dark side" or perhaps, the "white side". A score for the less likable! Hosannahs and kudos to the Wayans brothers for the laughs.

Thirdly,the heartwarming moments in this are just touching. Fourthly, the action and crime in this is just really good, It's like The Other Guys, but an earlier version.Congrats to everyone involved in this film.Thank you, this is a must see for the best movies.This has been A Joseph Akers Review

Little Man is the most over-hyped, unfunny, and immature movie made. It stars Shawn and Marlon Wayans, who were great together in Don't Be A Menace and in The Wayans Bros., so you would think it would be a good movie. The Wayans Brothers even promoted the movie themselves on both BET and Comedy Central. There were commercials for Little Man running round the clock on every television channel out there. Sure, what they were showing on the commercials didn't seem that funny, but, hey, it stars Shawn and Marlon, right? Well, I had a felling the movie would suck, and it did. My brother and I didn't laugh once, and we love the Wayans Brothers comedy. The movie was lame. But the 8 year old kids in the theater couldn't stop laughing.

reviews.review_title: Summer Movie Escapism. (Nothing more, nothing less...)
reviews.content: Not everyone have the same comedy tastes. With most movie marketing nowadays, it's 50/50 whether or not the movie itself is worth your time and money to go see. That being said, this latest offering from Shawn and Marlon Wayans (with directing duties by oldest sibling, Keenan) met my expectations. It Made Me Laugh AND was worth it.Yes, some of the jokes go for broke with the simple visual "lowbrow" or "groaner" but, if it puts a smile on your face, then it's done it's job entertaining me.No, I wasn't expecting "Oscar-Caliber acting", but I know that given the talent of the Wayans brothers, along with the supporting cast of Tracy Morgan, John Witherspoon and several other talented comedy-actors and actresses (look for cameos by former "In Living Color" AND "Saturday Night Live" Alumni as well), I was thoroughly entertained and dare I say? "Laughing at one point with tears in my eyes!"Also, from a "technological" stand point: I applaud Marlon Wayans for acting "with only his face" and the actors who "performed" as his "body" and the near-seamless combination to make them appear "as one", as the pint-sized ex-felon.In these times of wars, high gas prices and a stumbling economy, I salute the Wayans' for at least doing something to put a smile on my face in these challenging times and my rating reflects that.It ain't "Rocket Science"... It's simple "Summer Movie Escapism". Have a laugh. (We ALL can benefit from it).

I absolutely love the Wayans bros, and this movie is one of their finest. In "Little Man", a small thief named Calvin (Marlon Wayans) is hired to steal a prized diamond. On the run from the cops, he stashes it into a woman's bag without her knowing. When he hears that she and her husband (Shawn Wayans) are expecting a baby, he disguises himself as one in order to sneak in and get the diamond back. Brilliant idea!!! It has a lot of comedy and visual effects, which you don't normally see together in one film. Also when Calvin makes "babbling noises" such as, "Goo-goo gaa-gaa", that's really funny too. Three words for this film: Pure. Comic. Genius.

"Little Man", now on DVD, is a Wayans Brothers flop. It's the tale of a smaller than a midget criminal played by Marlon Wayans, who hides a diamond in a lady's purse after a heist. He and his partner Tracy Morgan cook up the genius plan to disguise Marlon as a baby and plant him at the lady's home. He then goes through all sorts of "Home Alone" or "Child's Play" like mayhem to get the jewel back and be treated like a baby. I was surprised by how low the humor was in this film. The jokes have been done in other places so many times, that they aren't cute or funny. I almost think the movie might have been funnier if they didn't use CGI and used the small actor who Marlon's face was pasted over. In watching the deleted scenes (minus CGI) this actor was funny in a Mini-me like way, but they chose a different route. A few cameos and Tracy Morgan make some funny scenes..Spend your rental fee $ on Borat if you want some real laughs these days.http://mcmusicnotes.blogspot.com

Watch out for Tracy Morgan he is good comedian I compare him to the late Richard Pryor.

reviews.review_title: I've seen some rubbish in my time but....
reviews.content: First of all I must say that White Chicks was OK and had funny moments, mostly thanks to Terry Crews' character, but if your expecting better than White Chicks then stay away from Little man. I watched the first 20-30 minutes of the film and could not take it. The jokes were recycled and felt like they had been done before (many times). Pretty unfunny in general and boring, almost as bad as Scary movie 4 (Which would take a lot to beat).The main concern I have with Little man is the obvious computer generated graphics, it's bad when seen in small doses in other films but this goes beyond... it's constant and screams out whenever you see Marlon Wayans, every movement he makes is jerky and blurry and made me cringe.This film had way too much promotion when it was released, and surprised me that it was shown at cinemas. All this said the DVD would make a great mirror or frisbee... But by all means do not buy it as a gift, no matter how tempting the bargain bin may be.

i voted 10/10 because of the hard work on editing and very nice idea!well, what you need to know it's that it is HAAAAARD as hell to make this movie. first you need to film all the scenes with that little boy (Porco), and there comes the first test: how do the actors "enter in their rule" when they are talking to somebody who's not the "final actor"? then you need to film ALL the "little man" scenes again on "blue screen" with the other actor making faces... are you kidding me, Marlon had to been shoot from all the same angles as that little boy... and then.... the HELL IS AWAKEN when the editors have to "paste" all the scenes... omg... i loved the movie by that perspective, as a colleague editor, i'm "feelin this $#!T"... the acting on the other hand, as in all Wayans's movies... 5/10 but we all love them for their way to be different then others!peace'n'love Haris

"Little Man" is a stupid comedy, stupid because the jokes are cheap, the premise is ridiculous and because the film makers think that audiences will be stupid enough to buy into the film. Even if you are able to buy that a grown man could trick people into thinking that, because of his short height he is a baby/toddler, the filmmakers make the huge mistake of actually showing him alongside real babies, which completely destroys the illusion and makes you wonder how stupid these characters are. The jokes consist mostly of crotch shots, lame sex jokes (including a scene where "Calvin" pretends to be "Vanessa's" husband during the middle of the night so they can have sex, which is rape, not a joke) and characters looking bug eyed as a little man that is supposed to pass off as a small child does inappropriate things. It may have a few lonely laughs here and there, but this is a movie that's so stupid it's offensive. (Dvd, November 23, 2012)

rt_summary: Posing as an abandoned toddler, a very small fugitive (Marlon Wayans) from the law tricks a couple (Shawn Wayans, Kerry Washington) into taking him in. Once there, the baby-faced thief endures the other man's attempts at fatherhood while waiting for a chance to take back the stolen gem he hid in the wife's purse.
